intro: Reseda cahirana, commonly known as the Cahiran Ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its upright stems and yellow flowers. It has lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Reseda cahirana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands.
